segments.text: Are you sure you're all right ? You look a bit worried today . Is anything wrong ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Well , yes , there is something wrong actually . Perhaps you can give me some advice .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Well , last night when I returned from the theatre , I found that I'd lost my wallet .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Oh dear ! That's terrible ! What was in your wallet ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Well , some money . of course , my visa , all my identity cards and some photos .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Well , if were you , I'd go to the police station straight away and report it .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Yes , I've already done that , and they said they'd look for it . But we're leaving soon and I need my visa and identity cards badly .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Oh dear ! What a pity ! Are you sure you lost the wallet in the theatre ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I think you should put an advertisement in the China Daily , saying when and where you lost it .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Wait a minute ! My uncle lives in Beijing and he lives very close to the theatre . I'll telephone him and ask him to go there to inquire about it . You'd better have breakfast now and I'll meet you later .
segments.speaker: S1
